div.strong: All school buildings are currently closed at this time. Please refer any questions to the administration office at (765) 536-0008, and please leave a message. We are frequently checking our messages and will return your call as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience in this unprecedented time.

div.p: Chromebook Assistance: The technology department will be available at the Jr./Sr. High School Monday through Friday from 7:30 to 11:30 a.m. for Chromebook assistance. You can reach them at (765) 536-0032 ext. 1501. Please call the technology department before visiting the school.
Extended eLearning schedule: Beginning March 31, the Extended eLearning schedule is as follows:
eLearning days will occur on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. We will be using waiver days on Mondays and Fridays.

div.p: Starting on Monday, April 13, 2020, we have adjusted our student meal pick ups to Tuesdays only from 3:00 to 6:00 p.m.
Each student package will contain five breakfasts and five lunches. This schedule will remain through Tuesday, May 19, 2020. Pick up is available at Park and Summitville.
Thank you for your flexibility as we work to keep our community safe!

link.p: Welcome! The school year is in full swing, and we are so proud of how our students have grown since the beginning of the year. Madison-Grant is growing right along with them and has much to celebrate!

ul.li: We have a student who achieved national recognition in our arts department by earning "Gold Key" status and has their work displayed in New York.
Our preschool offerings achieved Level 3 ratings in Paths to Quality, recognized as High Quality preschool programs.
Over two hundred students and staff have volunteered in our community days at Summitville and Fairmount.
Two students earned "A+" certifications in technology, which allows them to gainful employment prior to graduating.
The United Way of Grant and Madison Counties recognized Madison-Grant for their community involvement and financial support.

We've increased our college credit offerings to over 40 choices, saving our families over $600,000 in three years with credits from IU Kokomo, Indiana Wesleyan, Ivy Tech (Marion), and Vincennes University.
We are producing clean solar energy on our junior-senior high campus, which demonstrates our commitment to a healthy environment and fiscal responsibility.

link.p: Do you like what you've read? Stop by our campuses and see for yourself! Whether you are considering full enrollment or a blended home-school/public-school enrollment, Madison-Grant has much to offer in college credits, industry certifications, and rich experiences in the arts!
